Reported to House (Amended) by House Committee on Public Works and Transportation.  Report No: 100-133.
Placed on House Calendar No: 41.

Called up by House on Call of Consent Calendar.

actions.committee: Committee on Environment and Public Works
actions.text: Received in the Senate and read twice and referred to the Committee on Environment and Public Works.
Senate Committee on Environment and Public Works discharged by Unanimous Consent.
Passed Senate without amendment by Voice Vote.
Cleared for White House.
Measure Signed in Senate.
Presented to President.
Signed by President.
Became Public Law No: 100-608.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Public Buildings and Grounds

official_title: A bill to designate the building which will house the Federal Court for the Eastern District of Texas in Lufkin, Texas, as the "Ward R. Burke Federal Court Building".

summary.text: (Measure passed House, amended) Designates the building which will house the U.S. District Court for the Eastern District of Texas at Third Street and Lufkin Avenue in Lufkin, Texas, as the Ward R. Burke United States Courthouse.

titles.title: A bill to designate the building which will house the Federal Court for the Eastern District of Texas in Lufkin, Texas, as the "Ward R. Burke Federal Court Building".
